skill.name: tailwind-design-system
skill.description: Build scalable design systems with Tailwind CSS, design tokens, component libraries, and responsive patterns. Use when creating component libraries, implementing design systems, or standardizing UI patterns.
skill.summary: Build scalable design systems with Tailwind CSS, design tokens, component libraries, and responsive ...

security_audit.summary: Only documentation and example code were found. No file system access, network calls, or execution patterns were detected.

content.value_statement: Design systems often drift without clear tokens and patterns. This skill provides Tailwind structures to standardize components, themes, and responsive layouts.
actual_capabilities: Provide Tailwind config with semantic color tokens and radius tokens
Define CSS variables for light and dark themes
Outline CVA based button variants and sizes
Show form input and label patterns with error states
Detail responsive grid and container utilities
limitations: Does not generate a full project or install dependencies
Does not validate tokens against a brand guide
Does not run tests or audit live UI output
Does not migrate existing code automatically

use_cases.title: Standardize team components
use_cases.description: Create shared Tailwind tokens and base components to align multiple product teams.

use_cases.title: Build token architecture
use_cases.description: Map brand colors to semantic tokens and wire them to Tailwind themes.

use_cases.title: Ship responsive layouts
use_cases.description: Use grid and container patterns to scale layouts across breakpoints.

prompt_templates.title: Starter tokens
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Tailwind token setup with semantic colors and radius variables for light and dark themes.

prompt_templates.title: Button variants
prompt_templates.prompt: Design CVA button variants with sizes, states, and accessibility notes for a shared component library.

prompt_templates.title: Form patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide input and label component patterns with error handling and ARIA guidance.

prompt_templates.title: Responsive grid
prompt_templates.prompt: Define a responsive grid and container utility pattern for product cards across breakpoints.

output_examples.input: Set up a Tailwind design system with tokens and a button pattern
output: Defined semantic color tokens and radius variables for light and dark themes
Outlined a CVA button with variants, sizes, and focus ring behavior
Included accessibility notes for keyboard and error states

best_practices: Use semantic tokens and map them to CSS variables
Document component variants and default states
Test focus states for keyboard navigation
anti_patterns: Hardcoding brand colors in component classes
Using arbitrary values instead of theme extensions

faq.question: What platforms can use this skill?
faq.answer: It works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code as a text based guidance skill.

faq.question: Are there usage limits?
faq.answer: No limits are defined in the skill; your platform may have its own limits.

faq.question: How do I integrate it into my project?
faq.answer: Apply the provided Tailwind config patterns and component structures in your codebase.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, the skill content is static and does not access files or network resources.

faq.question: What if the output does not match my theme?
faq.answer: Adjust semantic token values to match your brand and reapply the patterns.

faq.question: How does it compare to general Tailwind advice?
faq.answer: It focuses on design system structure, tokens, and reusable component patterns.
